channel.title: Comments for RIP Los Angeles
channel.description: Blogging demolitions one building at a time.

item.title: Comment on 10555 Bloomfield Street, Toluca Lake by Kim Cooper
item.dc:creator: Kim Cooper
item.description: It was ugly today at the Planning and Land Use Management Committee, as citizens cried corruption and the newly elected "reform" Councilmember Nithya Raman was MIA, which allowed the developer claim to have her support--and the citizens to counter no, she supported them. The story is in our live tweets: https://twitter.com/esotouric/status/1352331219686588421
item.content:encoded: It was ugly today at the Planning and Land Use Management Committee, as citizens cried corruption and the newly elected “reform” Councilmember Nithya Raman was MIA, which allowed the developer claim to have her support–and the citizens to counter no, she supported them. The story is in our live tweets: https://twitter.com/esotouric/status/1352331219686588421

item.title: Comment on 4629-4651 W. Maubert Ave. by Niki Swenson
item.dc:creator: Niki Swenson
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://www.riplosangeles.com/4629-4651-w-maubert-ave/#comment-56">Nick Santangelo</a>.
The desecration that is happening here in East Hollywood is TRULY DISGUSTING! It started when Garcetti was over this district and has continued with all the other goons that have come since him. It’s so sad to see how the homeless population has increased and continues to increase. Please bring back humanity! STOP THE HOME STEALING!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Nick Santangelo.

The desecration that is happening here in East Hollywood is TRULY DISGUSTING! It started when Garcetti was over this district and has continued with all the other goons that have come since him. It’s so sad to see how the homeless population has increased and continues to increase. Please bring back humanity! STOP THE HOME STEALING!

item.title: Comment on Easing Back Into It, via 915 S. Grand View by Kim Cooper
item.dc:creator: Kim Cooper
item.description: It's great to have you back on the threatened building beat, Nathan. Too many of these fine places are falling to the completely discretionary TOC upzoning scam that enriches politicians and causes grave harm to the commons. The work you're doing is important. Your books are amazing, too!
item.content:encoded: It’s great to have you back on the threatened building beat, Nathan. Too many of these fine places are falling to the completely discretionary TOC upzoning scam that enriches politicians and causes grave harm to the commons. The work you’re doing is important. Your books are amazing, too!

item.title: Comment on Pacific Bowling Center/Dancing Waters Club, 1331 S. Pacific Ave. by Yolanda Banda
item.dc:creator: Yolanda Banda

I was born their and remember seeing Barry. White buying his mom prescription.
item.content:encoded:

I was born their and remember seeing Barry. White buying his
mom prescription.

item.title: Comment on 3525 South Bronson Ave. by Thelma Mericle
item.dc:creator: Thelma Mericle
item.description: Such a beautiful diamond in the rough. C'mon someone - step up to the plate and make this ol' girl beautiful again! Does anyone know anyone who may be interested? Ask around. Let's don't let her disappear!
item.content:encoded: Such a beautiful diamond in the rough. C’mon someone – step up to the plate and make this ol’ girl beautiful again! Does anyone know anyone who may be interested? Ask around. Let’s don’t let her disappear!

item.title: Comment on 10555 Bloomfield Street, Toluca Lake by Kim Cooper
item.dc:creator: Kim Cooper
item.description: Two CEQA appeals filed by neighbors against what they view as corrupt "off-menu" upzoning of 10555 West Bloomfield Street. The appeals are posted here, and interested citizens can subscribe to get updates on the case and info on when to make public comment. https://cityclerk.lacity.org/lacityclerkconnect/index.cfm?fa=ccfi.viewrecord&cfnumber=20-1358
item.content:encoded: Two CEQA appeals filed by neighbors against what they view as corrupt “off-menu” upzoning of 10555 West Bloomfield Street. The appeals are posted here, and interested citizens can subscribe to get updates on the case and info on when to make public comment. https://cityclerk.lacity.org/lacityclerkconnect/index.cfm?fa=ccfi.viewrecord&cfnumber=20-1358

item.title: Comment on An Appeal to Reason at 1537 South Wilton Pl. by Steven Rowe
item.dc:creator: Steven Rowe
item.description: Please save 1737 South Wilton Place! We need to save as much historic architectural in Los Angeles as we can to retain it’s Architectural Heritage
item.content:encoded:
Please save 1737 South Wilton Place!
We need to save as much historic architectural in Los Angeles as we can to retain it’s Architectural Heritage

item.title: Comment on 4201 S. Crenshaw/3600 W. Stocker by Michael
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: Hi Nathan, Thank you for this history. I really appreciate the 'Bank' history of Liquor Bank via B of A. I'm doing cyanotypes and handmade negatives of developments in process (via the designers' renderings), and in this case want to do one just of the Liquor Bank's intersection. In any case, thanks again...i'm sure there's plenty of RIP in the Crenshaw/Leimert areas to keep track of...
item.content:encoded:
Hi Nathan,
Thank you for this history. I really appreciate the ‘Bank’ history of Liquor Bank via B of A.
I’m doing cyanotypes and handmade negatives of developments in process (via the designers’ renderings), and in this case want to do one just of the Liquor Bank’s intersection.
In any case, thanks again…i’m sure there’s plenty of RIP in the Crenshaw/Leimert areas to keep track of…

item.title: Comment on Taix and the City by Jennifer Perez
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Perez

item.title: Comment on 3525 South Bronson Ave. by Nathan Marsak
item.dc:creator: Nathan Marsak
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://www.riplosangeles.com/3525-south-bronson-ave/#comment-62">Paul Wright</a>.
Hey Paul——well I agree with everything you say, except for the final sentence (as you might imagine). The house needs a lot of love, but it's not so far gone that it can't be brought back. Maybe it's not a great block, or the best neighborhood for old houses (though there's some nifty old houses still on 12th, and Edgehill, even a couple on Norton) but I'd say that's exactly the <em>point</em> of our needing to retain this one; it's like the last of its kind in the area. A lot of people replying to the Instagram post were all "oh no! I know that house—I drive by it all the time and always notice it" because it's something of a landmark in those parts. If it vanishes then kids will grow up thinking the area was "born" into hacked n' whacked, without a touchstone of how it once was.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Paul Wright.

Hey Paul——well I agree with everything you say, except for the final sentence (as you might imagine). The house needs a lot of love, but it’s not so far gone that it can’t be brought back. Maybe it’s not a great block, or the best neighborhood for old houses (though there’s some nifty old houses still on 12th, and Edgehill, even a couple on Norton) but I’d say that’s exactly the point of our needing to retain this one; it’s like the last of its kind in the area. A lot of people replying to the Instagram post were all “oh no! I know that house—I drive by it all the time and always notice it” because it’s something of a landmark in those parts. If it vanishes then kids will grow up thinking the area was “born” into hacked n’ whacked, without a touchstone of how it once was.
